g.text: dependency of the elastic constants and the vibration phonon at the center point reveal the origin of
the second-order phase transition mechanismin GeSe. The group theory analysis shows that the phase
transition is induced by the softening of the low-frequency phonon mode in the interlayer.
J.Y. and Q.F. contributed equally to this work. Formal analysis, J.Y., Q.F., B.X., and Y.D.;
Funding acquisition, J.Y. and Q.F.; Investigation, J.Y. and Y.D.; Methodology, B.X.; Project administration, Q.F.
This work was supported by the Scientiﬁc Research Foundation of the Education Department of Sichuan
Province (Grant Nos. 17ZA0195 and 18CZ0030), Leshan Normal University (Grant Nos. Z16016, ZZ201806, and
ZZ201817), and the Science and Technology Bureau of Leshan City (Grant Nos. 18JZD114 and 19GZD006).
The authors wish to thank LvLiang Cloud Computing Center of China for calculation support.
) for its linguistic assistance during the preparation of this manuscript.
The authors declare no conﬂict of interest.
